thread.title: ‘Masaan’ made me speechless: Taslima Nasrin
thread.title_full: ‘Masaan’ made me speechless: Taslima Nasrin | The Financial Express

author: financialexpress.com
title: ‘Masaan’ made me speechless: Taslima Nasrin
text:
Other Articles 'Zoolander 2' trailer leaks online Bees naturally vaccinate their babies: Study 'Baahubali' is an inspiration: Shahrukh Khan Bangladeshi author Taslima Nasrin has praised debut director Neeraj Ghaywan’s award-winning film “Masaan”.
The Varanasi-set movie, which stars Richa Chadha, Sanjay Mishra, Shweta Tripathi and Vicky Kaushal, revolves around a bunch of characters trying to escape their small town moralities.
The 52-year-old author took to Twitter and lauded Ghaywan, saying she “didn’t have high hopes” from Hindi movies but “Masaan” surprised her.
“I didn’t have high hopes about Hindi movies as most of them were musical melodrama. But ‘Masaan’ made me speechless. I salute Neeraj Ghaywan,” she wrote.
The director replied, “overwhelmed! Thank you so much!”
“Big heroes of Bollywood should learn how to act from young actors of Masaan,” she wrote later.
Produced by Drishyam Films, Phantom Films, Macassar Productions and Sikhya Entertainment, “Masaan” was released on July 24.
First Published on August 02, 2015 4:13 pm
